newsitem.title: USA: Computer Learning files for 1.1 mln common.
newsitem.headline: Computer Learning files for 1.1 mln common.

text.p: Computer Learning Centers Inc filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission Wednesday for up to 1,134,784 common shares.
The Fairfax, Va.,-based computer school said that of the total it will sell 434,783 shares while stockholders will offer 700,001 shares.

Net proceeds will be used for working capital and general corporate purposes, including oepning of new facilities and expansion of its programs, the company said. It said it will not receive proceeds from any sale by shareholders.
It said the offering will be made through Robertson, Stephens & Co and Piper Jaffray Inc. The underwriters have an over-allotment option for up to 170,216 additional shares, it said.
